meanings.sent1: The bishop will be reordaining the new priests next week.
meanings.sent2: The church decided to reordain the minister after his return from a sabbatical.
meanings.sent3: The king joked that he might need reordaining after forgetting his royal duties.
meanings.sent4: The teacher felt like reordaining the classroom to bring back order.
meanings.sent5: The chef believed reordaining the menu would attract more customers.

meanings.sent1: The council will be reordaining the mayor for another term.
meanings.sent2: The elders decided to reordain the sacred relics for the upcoming ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The magician playfully suggested reordaining his hat to bring back his lost rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The artist felt like reordaining her studio to find new inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The captain believed reordaining the ship's course would lead them to safety.
